skillTree.localised_description: Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: Giant leonine statues, almost impervious to harm; they wade through foes, crushing them like bothersome insects.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: The pain of immortal misery, coupled with insane violence, characterises the return to Unlife for many of the Tomb Kings, who fight longer, harder and better than they ever could before.
You cannot build an empire without sacrificing a few sons…
The fluid used to embalm the Tomb King toughens his bindings, enabling him to withstand a greater degree of damage than would otherwise be possible.
Soaked in and toughened by embalming fluid, the cloth bindings used to mummify afford the wearer additional protection from all but a direct hit from mortal projectiles.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Symbolising immortality and eternity, the ruler of the Nehekharan Pantheon has always had a care for the wellbeing of his children.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Tomb Princes
	(factionwide)

Leadership: +4 for Tomb Guard and Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for Tomb Guard and Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "They stand staring into the sun for eternity, the physical embodiment of the everlasting gods. Terrible ye who looked into their divine forms!"

effects.description:
Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Recruit rank: +2 for Ushabti units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Ushabti and Ushabti (Great Bows) units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Ushabti and Ushabti (Great Bows) units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_name: Usirian the God of the Underworld
skillTree.localised_description: Those who oppose the faceless God of the Underworld shall suffer terribly, condemned to its lowest levels for eternity.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +15% for Casket of Souls units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_name: Asaph the Goddess of Magic & Vengeance
skillTree.localised_description: They who serve the Asp Goddess are blessed with a precise aim with which to reach their objectives.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +15
	(own army)

Missile strength: +12% for Skeleton Archers, Vulture Legion, Nehekhara Archers, Tomb Guard Archers, Royal Archers, Sepulchral Stalkers and Serpent Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_name: Khsar the God of the Desert
skillTree.localised_description: Those who serve the Faceless God excel at fighting among the never-ending stretches of sand thanks to his blessing.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +8 when fighting in desert terrain
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_name: Neru the Goddess of Protection and the Moon
skillTree.localised_description: Neru protects her most faithful followers.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +8 for Nehekhara Warriors, Tomb Guard, Royal Guard, Skeleton Warriors and Spearmen units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_name: Phakth the God of Sky and Justice
skillTree.localised_description: No one can escape the piercing gaze of the Hawk headed God, he who ensures a swift Justice for his foes.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +30 for Carrion units
	(Lord's army)

Melee Attack: +15 for Carrion units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_name: Sakhmet the Goddess of the Green Moon
skillTree.localised_description: The Green Witch is jealous for Ptra's love for the human race, always ready to cause destruction among humans she might give the secret of the darkest arts to her followers.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +3 for Liche Priests
	(factionwide)
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +6

Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Humans
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_name: Sokth the God of Scorpions, Poisoners and Thieves
skillTree.localised_description: Even though the Treacherous God is considered the protector of thieves, stealing from the dead is forbidden, so his scorpions are guarding the royal tombs of Nehekhara.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +20%

skillTree.localised_name: Tahoth the God of Knowledge and Wisdom
skillTree.localised_description: The Scholar of the Gods grants knowledge to those who seek and deserve it.

skillTree.localised_name: Ualatp, The God of Scavengers, The Vulture God
skillTree.localised_description: The Nehekhara Navy sailed the oceans and conquered distant lands in the name of the Vulture god Ualatp.

effects.description:
Attrition: -100% casualties suffered from high seas, reef and storm attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attribute: Unbreakable for Carrion units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: It is not possible to defeat such unshakeable spirit once its owner's mind is made up.
Kill many and you *are* a conqueror; godhood is then but a protracted slaughter away...
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
He whose will transcends death can strike out from beyond the grave, to devastating effect.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Death is not an impedance to the strongest of wills.
Beware the scorpion's sting, hidden 'neath the desert sands yet always poised to strike.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: A renowned General, Setep's knowledge of tactics and training would later prove invaluable as he trained his forces to overthrow King Lahkashaz hiding in his fortified cities.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +225
	(Lord's army)

Unit experience gain per turn: +125
	(all armies)

skillTree.localised_description: Few leaders could look King Setep in the face and not remember his skills in battle, or his stories of battle valour. Even the mightiest in their souls felt a tingle of fear when gazing on his sword.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Nehekharan society's disgust at the open worship of Nagash in Lahmia by Neferata was key to the groundswell of popular opinion to overthrow King Lahkashaz and install a leader who never again would tolerate even the name of Nagash to be said.

effects.description:
Leadership: +15 when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To march on the rightful King with his armies and take his place weighted greatly on General Setep as he took the throne, but the righteousness of his cause burned hard, and seldom have the common soldiers and people celebrated so wildly the overthrow of a King.

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -8 when enemy lays siege or encircles
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: "Damnation awaits those who would disturb his rest! Here be the souls of those that are lost..." - Inscribed on the Casket of Souls within the tomb of King Setep

effects.description:
Missile strength: +20% for Casket of Souls units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +15% for Skull Catapult, Bone Thrower and Casket of Souls units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: For restoring them to power and destroying the enemies of Nehekharan society the newly installed King Setep was showered in gifts and promises of immortal life by the Mortuary Cult.

effects.description:
Hero action success chance: +5% for Liche Priests
	(all characters)

Hero recruit rank: +2 for Liche Priests
	(factionwide)

Hero action success chance: +10% for Liche Priests
	(all characters)

Hero recruit rank: +4 for Liche Priests
	(factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: The common soldiers of Nehekhara flocked to General Setep's cause in life breaking all bonds of fealty. In death, his iron will inspires the common soldier of the undying legions to exertions well beyond those of others.

effects.description:
Unbreakable: Skeleton Spearmen and Skeleton Warriors
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

effects.description:
Perfect Vigour: Skeleton Spearmen and Skeleton Warriors
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

skillTree.localised_description: The promise of a glorious afterlife worthy of a courageous warrior keeps embattled troops focused on the grim task at hand.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Carrying the blessing of the goddess Asaph, these arrows seek out the foe with unerring accuracy.

skillTree.localised_description: Death isn't necessarily the end; those who have pledged service must rise to fight again another day.

skillTree.localised_description: Formed by long campaigns and bloody slaughter in the stifling desert heat, the bond between steed and rider cannot be broken, even when death tries to intervene.

skillTree.localised_description: "The swift charioteers of the king. They who pursue the sovereign's foes on the day of his awakening."

skillTree.localised_description: Simple stone is afforded more respect than other materials, for from its grain giant guardians are hewn, brought to shuddering life by the Liche Priests' sorcery.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Hierotitan, Necrolith Colossus, Khemric Titan, Ushabti and Ushabti (Great Bow) units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +9% for Ushabti (Great Bows) units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Not even stone is set in stone it seems – arcane death magic is used to bring tortured, savage vigour to once-dormant stone sentinels.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +6 for Sepulchral Stalkers, Necrosphinx and Tomb Scorpion units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Sepulchral Stalkers, Necrosphinx and Tomb Scorpion units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for Sepulchral Stalkers, Necrosphinx and Tomb Scorpion units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +8 for Sepulchral Stalkers, Necrosphinx and Tomb Scorpion units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It takes an iron will and unnatural - supernatural - strength to rally bound troops routed by magical means.
Arrows loosed under the ever-watchful eye of the Serpent Goddess find their marks with divine precision.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +15% for Skeleton Archers, Ushabti (Great Bows), Skeleton Horse Archers, Screaming Skull Catapult and Bone Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Skeleton Archers, Vulture Legion, Nehekhara Archers, Tomb Guard Archers, Royal Archers, Ushabti (Great Bow), Skeleton Horsemen Archers, Nehekhara Horsemen Archers, Screaming Skull Catapult, Bone Thrower and Bone Giant units (Rank 7 and above)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The desert itself is his steed.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Nehekhara Horsemen, Skeleton Horsemen, Tomb Guard Horsemen, Sepulchral Stalkers, Serpent Guard, Nehekhara Knights, Tomb Barque and Chariot units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A dream of glory attained through conquest great rages still, despite the dying of the light.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Nehekhara Warriors, Tomb Guard, Skeleton Warriors and Spearmen units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Nehekhara Warriors, Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Spearmen and Tomb Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Nehekhara Warriors, Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Spearmen and Tomb Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The very strength of the desert, to stand sentinel over the Tomb Kings' domain and crush their enemies to dust.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Ushabti, Scorpion, Skeleton War Elephant, Hierotitan, Necrolith Colossus, Khemric Titan, Necrosphinx and Khemrian Warsphinx units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Ushabti, Tomb Scorpion, Hierotitan, Necrosphinx and Khemrian Warsphinx units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for Ushabti, Tomb Scorpion, Hierotitan, Necrosphinx and Khemrian Warsphinx units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Dark litanies are uttered to restore the Tomb Kings' slain soldiers to a twisted, chattering imitation of life.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Some of war's spoils are more difficult to see but are just as valuable as gold or jewels.
This one scours the battlefields, plains and dunes for the vanquished dead, so that his armies may march at full strength once more.
These jars contain the remains of many Liche Priests, which are useful for raising and binding a new force.
Nehekhara's mummified rulers are awake, their eyes burning with balefire, their thirst for power, conquest and vengeance every bit as strong as they were in life.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: By which the Undead armies of Nehekhara may remain deathless, undying and forever hungry for slaughter.

effects.description:
Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -35% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To the victor, the spoils. All of them. Always.

effects.description:
Canopic Jars: +4% gained from battles
	(Lord's army)

Canopic Jars: +9% gained from battles
	(Lord's army)

Canopic Jars: +15% gained from battles
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It stands watch over the land, lest the foe's insidious, opportunistic agents dare to strike.
Renowned among their allies and feared by enemies both mortal and otherwise, this Lord's every deed adds to their already legendary reputation.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

items.colour_text: Though many inferior copies exist, no craftsman has ever been able to even come close to the original with their various "Blade's of Setep". These lesser enchanted weapons are mere pale shadows of the blade buried with the General-King himself.

contains.name: Icon of Histories Past and Vows Made

items.colour_text: In Setep's life this breastplate was engraved with images of vicious battles against nightmare creatures, which reminded all Nehekharans who saw it of the bleakest period of their history and of their vow to never again repeat it. Sadly the millienium have rubbed away the solomn hierogylphs proclaiming "Never Again!".

contains.name: Icon of Histories Past and Vows Made

items.onscreen_name: Icon of Histories Past and Vows Made
items.colour_text: Is is arguable if this Icon actually holds any magical properties whatsoever. Pinned to the front of King Setep's shield it simply serves as a reminder to loyal Nehekharan soldiers of the vows of featly and service they have taken in live, which they carry on with even into their unliving future. Some say it holds even greater meaning though, as Setep's forces seem to be able to unleash volley's from afar with almost pin-point accuracy.

effects.description:
Army Ability: "Setep's Hail of Arrows"
	(armies in local province)

target_if: Not on or below a platform

contains.name: Icon of Histories Past and Vows Made

items.colour_text: This urn contains the most damned and tortured souls of the Mortuary Cult; it's own betrayers. All those who have betrayed the Mortuary Cult through heresy have had their unliving bones are ground down and added to the urn to be tortured for all time. The Cult dreams of adding Arkhan the Black and Nagash's dust to this dread container.

	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_name: Icon of Histories Past and Vows Made
backgroundSkills.localised_description: Is is arguable if this Icon actually holds any magical properties whatsoever. Pinned to the front of King Setep's Shield it simply serves as a reminder to loyal Nehekharan soldiers of the vows of featly and service they have taken in live, which they carry on with even into their unliving future. Some say it holds even greater meaning though, as Setep's forces seem to be able to unleash volley's from afar with almost pin-point accuracy.

effects.description:
Army Ability: "Setep's Hail of Arrows"
	(armies in local province)

target_if: Not on or below a platform

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Though many inferior copies exist, no craftsman has ever been able to even come close to the original with their various "Blade's of Setep". These lesser enchanted weapons are mere pale shadows of the blade buried with the General-King himself.

nodes.localised_description: The rulers of Khemri prized them above everything except the eternal life that was their royal due. If a King was lucky enough to own a Dragon then it would invariably be slain and laid beside him as the greatest of his sacred guardians.

attributes.bullet_text: Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee. This attribute also adds a  +50% damage multiplier against buildings.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can fly.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus
